He selected 70,000 men to carry the building supplies and 80,000 men to cut stones
the hills. He also chose 3,600 men to supervise them.

Solomon told his workers to count all the people from other countries who were living in Israel, similar to what his father David had done. There were 153,600 of them.
Solomon assigned 70,000 of them to carry materials, and 80,000 to cut stone
the hills, and 3,600 of them to supervise the others and be sure that they worked steadily.
